poem:
### Sudden Fame

Words like flames—  
Rising, consuming,  
A torch in the hand  
Of a man once shadowed  
By quiet paths.  
Fame rattles like  
Unseen chains,  
Madness prowling  
In the spaces between,  
Where laughter echoes  
And truth stands bare.  
In the blaze of eyes,  
A whisper of  
Who he was—  
Still lingers.
